snippet: Shelling and clashes between soldiers and rebel fighters in the city of Dara’a on Saturday claimed 17 lives, activists said, a day after a United Nations team collected evidence of a mass atrocity.
abstract: Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, an opposition group based in London with a network of contacts in Syria, reports new violence in southwest Syria, saying shelling by troops and clashes between soldiers and rebel fighters in the city of Dara’a had killed 17 people, including women and children; in the capital, Damascus, residents report a night of shooting and explosions in the worst violence there since the uprising began.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Shelling and clashes between soldiers and rebel fighters in the city of Dara’a on Saturday claimed 17 lives, activists said, a day after a United Nations team collected evidence of a mass atrocity.

headline.seo: Deadly Shelling Strikes Syrian City of Dara’a, Activists say
headline.main: More Unrest Around Syria, in Hot Spots Old and New
headline.print_headline: 17 Are Killed In Clashes In Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
